results.title: The Ant and the grasshopper
results.brief_description: This animated fable points out the familiar moral that we can’t play all the time but must work and save for a time of need. While all the ants labor industriously to provide for the coming winter, the grasshopper rests in the summer sun. But when winter comest, the grasshopper finds it difficult to live and it is the ants turn to sing and play. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Ant and the dove
results.creator_credit: Gakken Company and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: One good turn deserves another is the moral of this fable by Aesop. This charming tale of an ant who, despite his small size, is able to save the life of his friend, the dove, will stimulate and delight young children.

results.title: The Answer is understanding
results.creator_credit: Associated Film Consultants and National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Illustrates some of the difficulties involved in dealing with the problems of drug addiction. Examines the growing of opium in the Middle East, the history of drug use, the complex social patterns of drug use, the variety of pressures towards drug dependence in urban life, and the difficulty of preventing drugs from entering the United States. Elements of the drug problem in many overseas countries are also examined.

results.title: The Anniversary party
results.creator_credit: Pas de Quoi, Fine Line Features, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Alan Cumming and Joanne Sellar
results.brief_description: The Anniversary party was co-directed, co-written and co-produced by actors Alan Cumming and Jennifer Jason Leigh, marking the latter’s directorial debut. The story centres on a married couple (Leigh and Cumming), who decide to hold a party to celebrate their sixth wedding anniversary. She is an aging actress past her prime; he is a writer set to direct the film version of his novel. Over the course of the day and the night guests come and go, consisting of friends, colleagues and neighbours, mostly Hollywood types involved in the film industry in some way or another. Having only recently re-united after a tumultuous period, both partners are to a degree on edge and eager to display the stability of their union. The status quo becomes increasingly tested over the course of the soiree as revelations threaten to destroy their re-established happiness. Having collaborated on the script for several years the two directors conceived the film as a low budget ensemble comedy/drama and this feature was originally shot on video. Stars: Alan Cumming, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Kevin Klein, Jane Adams, Phoebe Cates, John C. Reilly, Parker Posey, Gwyneth Paltrow and Jennifer Beals.

results.title: The Anniversary
results.creator_credit: Seven Arts-Hammer Film Productions, Jimmy Sangster and Roy Baker
results.brief_description: An off-beat, devilish black comedy based on the popular stage play by Bill MacIlwraith. Bette Davis rules the roost as the matriach of a most unusual family. The mother of three grown sons, the one-eyed Mrs Taggart is a relentless dominatrix and will stop at nothing to keep her spineless offspring under her thumb. Although the husband she despised has been dead for ten years, she continues to observe her wedding anniversary by insisting that her sons return home for the celebration. However, this year they arrive with something else on their minds - independence from her grasp. Co-starring Sheila Hancock, Jack Hedley, Christian Roberts, James Cossins and Elaine Taylor.

results.title: The Animatrix
results.creator_credit: DNA Films (GB), Mad House, Silver Pictures, Square USA, Studio 4 C, Andy Wachowski, Larry Wachowski, Peter Chung, Andy Jones, Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Takeshi Koike, Mahiro Maeda, Koji Morimoto and Shinichiro Watanabe
results.brief_description: These nine short films, from eminent directors and animators, explore the concepts of the enormously popular cult science-fiction film “The Matrix” (Andy Wachowski, Larry Wachowski, 1999), fleshing out side and back-stories of the principal narrative. “The Final flight of the Osiris” (dir. Andy Jones): When the crew aboard a hovercraft witness a menacing mechanical army amassing, one woman travels, at great peril, to the other side. “The Second Renaissance Part 1” (dir. Mahiro Maeda): Explains how human beings became the architect of their own demise by inventing robots to do their bidding, before the machines, desiring autonomy and freedom, rose up against their masters. “The Second Renaissance Part 2” (dir. Mahiro Maeda): The war of man versus the machines begins. “Kid’s story” (dir. Shinichiro Watanabe): A high school student who discovers the truth about the Matrix goes on the run from secret agents. “Program” (dir. Yoshiaki Kawajiri): In a segment with medieval overtones, two warriors engage in a fierce battle whilst debating the meaning of existence. “World record” (dir. Takeshi Koike): A talented track star discovers the secrets behind the Matrix. “Beyond” (dir. Koji Morimoto): Whilst searching for her missing cat, a young woman discovers a dilapidated building where children reside with the power to defy gravity and slow down time. “A Detective story” (dir. Shinichiro Watanabe): Paying homage to film noir, a private investigator goes in search of Trinity. “Matriculated” (dir. Peter Chung): Several members of the human resistance attempt to reprogram a machine to fight for their side.
results.creator_credit_for_label: DNA Films (GB), Mad House, Silver Pictures, Square USA, Studio 4 C, Andy Wachowski, Larry Wachowski, Peter Chung, Andy Jones, Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Takeshi Koike, Mahiro Maeda, Koji Morimoto and Shinichiro Watanabe

results.title: The Animations of Antoinette Starkiewicz
results.creator_credit: Julia Overton, Antoinette Starkiewicz and Richard Hartley
results.brief_description: This tape is a compilation of 4 award winning films from animator Antoinette Starkiewicz. Included on the tape are: “Pianoforte”; The animated adventures of an ambitious young girl pianist taken from the simplicity and magic of childhood into the baroque world of the nightclub. Led by a malevolent master of ceremonies into a hot pink pleasure den devoted to rhumba rhythms and erotic boogie, she is trapped, only to escape through the powers of love. “Pussy pumps up”; This is an allegorical tale explaining the differences and similarities of men and women. Pussy has the ability to transpose herself between the opposites, and in so doing typifies the traits of both in unity and division. “Putting on the ritz”; This is a kind of animated tribute to Fred Astaire, led by a tap dancing hero who leads a bevy of beautiful babes through an Irving Berlin song. “High fidelity”; A young girl, an amalgam of Marilyn Monroe and Shirley Temple goes through her the tricks and steps at her disposal to catch her dancing man.

results.title: The Animation game
results.brief_description: Designed for teachers and students, this film is an introduction to animating on film. Covers drawn, model, cut-out and pixilation animation techniques. Geoffrey Rush stars as the Professor. Animation by David Johnson. Suitable for upper primary, secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Animals of Farthing Wood
results.creator_credit: EBU, BBC, John Mills, Elphin Lloyd-Jones and Philippe LeClerc
results.brief_description: This is a series of animated films about the animals of Farthing Wood and their journey. Kestrel brings news that the humans are filling in the pond, and with no source of water, they would surely die. Toad advises that they should head for the nature reserve at White Deer Park. They set off on a very long journey, full of adventure and excitement. Based on the bestselling books of Colin Dann.

results.title: The Animals are crying
results.creator_credit: PMS Films, Paul Martin Smith and Peter Beltz
results.brief_description: This film shows how pet owners fail to understand the responsibility of raising animals by telling about the garbage men who almost discard a box until they realise there are live kittens in it. Also suggests owners spay their female cats. (Short version). Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
